page.title: 01MARHAM (EAST) R.A.F. AND FEN
page.content: The southern edge of the block is located on high ground some 21m above sea level. On this high ground is found the domestic area and parts of the airfield of Royal Air Force Marham. Access to R.A.F. Marham is gained from the eastern end of Marham village by a road climbing steeply southwards up the hill. At the bottom of the hill near the 'Fox and Hounds' public house the road forms a junction with Norborough Road running eastwards to the Marham/Norborough Parish boundary which divides the block from north to south. The northern edge of the block is located in the low lying ground through which the river Nar passes Westerly towards King's Lynn, Water is extracted from Nar and from Marham Fen by the Anglian Water Authority to supply their nereby waterworks.
